website_summaries.verdict: This exceedingly popular keyboard tray offers buyers supreme comfort with top-quality construction.
pros: Able to use tray in either sitting or standing position
cons: Can be a little difficult to adjust

customer_reviews.title: Small Platform; Not Easy to Adjust; Poor Product Support from 3M
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard platform itself is very small so if you have long fingers or large hands, you likely won't have enough room to work comfortably. The up and down adjustment is not intuitive at all which is frustrating. My primary issue was the mouse platform adjustment. Despite using the dial underneath, my platform would not tilt or adjust in any way. Called 3M tech support and they said "yeah, that piece can be difficult to work with." Zero suggestions on how to get it to operate properly
customer_reviews.author: TravelinFoodie

customer_reviews.title: I love it....BUT...
customer_reviews.text: I am happy to have this, as it is nice quality and mostly sturdy, BUT, if you rely on instructions to put things together, you will either be sending this back or paying someone a $100 bucks to install it. I am surprised by the lack of instruction from 3M on this. There are very tiny pics with zero wording on what to do. There is no A,B,C instruction, so unless you are handy at figuring things out on your own or paying someone else to do it for you, I would find something else.
customer_reviews.author: R. D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Knob hits your knee...be warned
customer_reviews.text: The stand-up concept of this keyboard is very good. The problem I have is when I sit down the adjustment knob is at my right knee all the time. It is not comfortable. I sit or stand depending on what I am working on and constantly hit my knee when I do sit. I'm 5' 7". I wouldn't buy it if I had to do it over. UPDATE: I've been using this keyboard for over a month now, and I definitely would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: L.B.

customer_reviews.title: stores well  - beveled glass table attached
customer_reviews.text: I have this keyboard installed on a beveled glass top table. Adjustments had to be made (inserts not provided) to attach to the beveled glass. The shelf adjusts up and down;however, I have an ergonomic keyboard that sits higher in the center and it has to be lower due to the knuckle of the clamp. My I cannot type under my desk due to my height (5'8") and the height of my desk. The drawer does store under the desk and the shelf is long enough for my keyboard on mouse. It feels secure on the table.... 10 minutes after writing this review. the velcor that attachs the drawer pulled. You cannot put weight on the drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shipped with the wrong Keyboard Platform!
customer_reviews.text: Product is built sturdy and with quality. However, the product was shipped with the incorrect keyboard platform that does not accommodate the sliding plate onto the track. Will return, since I was unable to completely install the product. Unknown if the design of the track being held up by command tape and Velcro will with stand the weight of the keyboard platform due to the heavy weight. Durable product, but it may present a design flaw that will need additional modifications to sustain.
customer_reviews.author: KTV

customer_reviews.title: Wrist wrests are thinner and weaker than a condom...
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this thing for a couple of weeks and the mouse pad wrist wrest is already leaking sticky goop... It's a pain in the ass to install so zero chance of taking it off and returning and 3m has no way to contact them about a replacement pad.
customer_reviews.author: W. D. Wright

customer_reviews.title: The mouse pad height is adjustable!
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty solid choice for a higher-end mobile keyboard tray, installation was fairly easy but the directions definitely could have been better. My major problem was that the default settings for the mouse pad place it 2 inches above the keyboard surface, which is rough on the wrist. After some trial and error however, I discovered that loosening the bolt on the mousepad enough allows you to flip the base upside down, which brings the mouse pad level with the top of the keyboard tray. So overall it's completely functional and adjustable, but the directions are definitely lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Sturdy and Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Very easy to install and mount stable and I use an Ikea stand desk. I have a large Microsoft Natural Ergo keyboard so I don't need the keyboard rest. I got an open box from Amazon Warehouse and it had pet hair everywhere, and i'm alergic... No stars off though because it does not go to quality, but I didn't have a fun time de-hairing all the parts with hair stuck to lubricant. It's a little cumbersome to make small adjustments on one axis without another axis moving, but it works out to be good enough if you go slowly and have a bit of patience.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Home office made better
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on the bottom of the base on my desk. This is well built and there is a lot of different holes for mounting. I have been using this for about 6 weeks now everyday as I work home due to COVID-19 and now I don't ever want to go back to the office.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: The best keyboard tray I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Easy to install and and easy to use. We have it mounted to a counter top that has about a half-inch lip hanging down from the counter top, and it still works. So, if your desk or counter top has a lip that hangs down a little, this will work. I researched and compared this to the other models where the mouse is on a separate board (usually slightly elevated). According to ergonomic experts, this type is better than the type where the mouse is on a separate board as it is better for your arms and wrist to stay on the same plane. Note, it is a bit heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality all the way around
customer_reviews.text: I purchasd 08/07/2016, now today 11/01/2017 the wrist rest has 'exploded' from a faulty seam area. The mouse pad is starting to discolor with dusty look to the surface and I have a chip on the back of the key board tray (where my keyboard cord is) and it has allowed the 'particle board' to start to show through. Poor quality all the way around, I am in the process of contacting 3M about the 5 yr. warranty for the 'chip' area.
customer_reviews.author: George M.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality--overpriced.  Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.text: It started out alright, but I've been using it about a week and it's falling apart. The screws that attach the keyboard platform to the retractable 'arm' that slides underneath the desk have fallen out. I've tried putting them back, but they fall out again after a few hours of use. Also, the platform isn't as adjustable as the description led me to believe. Overall, I wouldn't recommend this product, especially for the cost. It's way overpriced for the quality. I expected more from the 3M brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jan B Matson

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to install. Instruction cryptic or non-existent.
customer_reviews.text: I like the sturdiness of the final product. It is very adjustable. Installation instructions are given in drawings and many of them are clear enough. Others feature black on grey with details so small a magnifying glass was very necessary. There are no operating instructions. I learned how to operate by revisiting the product description online and by discovering how it works by examining it. .The product is the marriage two products: the keyboard tray and the mounting that allows the tray to be slid out and in under the desktop. The holes that must line up to join the two were barely so making installation that much more difficult. Good engineering; bad customer consideration.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lynn

customer_reviews.title: It's a little pricey, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This was fairly easy to install, with clear directions. It is sturdy and easily moved to different positions; This was important for my husband's carpal tunnel issues. We bought new office furniture which is beautiful and open, and the pullout keyboard "drawer" was too small to hold my husband's wide keyboard. The 3M Sit/Stand Adjustable Keyboard Tray was a perfect solution for three reasons; 1) his extra wide keyboard fit on it nicely; 2) it is adjustable for wrist comfort; and 3) and best of all, since his keyboard drawer was unusable to hide the keyboard aesthetic reasons, it can now be tucked, unseen, out of the way. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Sea

customer_reviews.title: Much better than more expensive standing desk options!
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking at other standing desk options for some time, but none properly addressed the problem that my sitting desk is too high. Instead of allowing the keyboard tray to drop below the top the desk, the other options actually add a little extra to the lowest keyboard height (i.e. the top of the desk). This adjustable tray is AWESOME! I can now sit with an ergonomically correct keyboard/mouse height OR stand with an equally ergonomically correct keyboard/mouse height (I am six feet tall and expect the same would be true for someone 2-3 inches taller).
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R Amos

customer_reviews.title: HAVE PAIN? BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the BEST purchases I have ever made! At my office I have a large L shaped desk with two wide monitors in the corner section. I have a lot of arm, hand, shoulder and back pain. The MANY adjustable features on this fantastic product is very beneficial for anyone who deals with a lot of pain. It will even pull out and up so that you can stand to work on it when needing to get out of your chair! LOVE THIS! The wrist rest is of fantastic quality too!
customer_reviews.author: SewLambitious

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I can't give this more than one star, sorry! Installation instructions are entirely crappy, and there were absolutely NO instructions on how to operate it once installed. We did manage to get it installed, but it doesn't even go low enough to be able to slide under the desk with the keyboard on it. The tray itself barely slides under the desk, without the keyboard. All in all, I totally wasted $160.00.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Its okay
customer_reviews.text: So i have had this for a while now. And for the keyboard it works great, but for the mouse its not the greatest. The area for the mouse is so small. If your a gamer dont buy bc there isnt enough room for the mouse. Also the sturdiness of this product is less than expected. For something over a 100 dollars thought the quailty would be alot better but its not. Any type of pressure from ur hands resting on the keyboard to controlling the mouse will make it laen to one side. Saveur money.
customer_reviews.author: Shane &Tamara Zamlich

customer_reviews.title: I chose this because the my drop-down desk has beautiful finish when closed up and not used for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Unit is far too heavy to secure with just the velcro strips. I chose this because the my drop-down desk has beautiful finish when closed up and not used for a desk. The velcro kept separating so I had to cut a support rod which I capped at each end with rubber chair floor protectors and then wedged it between under unit and floor to prevent the long under support from falling from the velcro attachment. Works fine this way, at least my furniture face remains unharmed.
customer_reviews.author: Pajab

customer_reviews.title: Velcro? 🤣
customer_reviews.text: Did they think velcro was going to hold this? I saw that when I got it she thought I'd give it a try. Nope, as I'm doing my work, my stuff slams down into my already injured knee! Thanks 3M! Thanks for also making it impossible to get directly in touch with you
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Paulsson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I’ve given this product two chances and still unimpressed. The first one had damage to the platform so I was sent a replacement. The new product showed up missing parts... not what I expected to see from a well known brand.
customer_reviews.author: Marlee

customer_reviews.title: The arm didn't move at all, I returned it ...
customer_reviews.text: The arm didn't move at all, I returned it because there was no way to slide the arm for installation, let alone to use it. Maybe if you don't get a defective one it's ok, but for the price, none of them should be defective. Note that this item is VERY HEAVY, also, that tools ARE required for installation.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It can bring the keyboard above the desk height which is good for encouraging good posture and it tilts nicely which I like too. I was surprised to see that it won't retract fully beneath my 24" deep desk but that's not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely worth every penny! This replaced one of those cheap pull out trays that comes with most office furniture you buy at Office Depot, Staples or Office Max. This is exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: GeorgiaDawg

customer_reviews.title: The quality otherwise is good, so hopefully this problem will be fixed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to use in her dorm room. She cannot permanently attach this with screws, and the adhesive strips are not strong enough to keep the tray attached. I hoped that 3M would have improved the adhesive since there was feedback about this, but apparently not. She has only been using the tray for a week or so, but it will not stay attached and is unusable right now. The quality otherwise is good, so hopefully this problem will be fixed. I have not reached out to 3M for a solution, but may try that route.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: this sounds like a great idea
customer_reviews.text: So, this sounds like a great idea...until it falls on the floor repeatedly. It won't stay up. the tray velcro's to a plate that's affixed with command strips. However, there's not enough velcro to actually keep it up!! Skip this one and buy the one with the screws.
customer_reviews.author: athena2703

customer_reviews.title: Its' as good as others say it is.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this along with a Logitech trackball and I really love this thing. I previous had one of the cheaper versions of the adjustable keyboard, and it wiggled and swayed. It wasn't as solid as this one. You do get what you pay for with this. The ability to quickly adjust it is the next best part. With the trackball, it simply is a no brainer for my setup. Yes it is expensive, no doubt about it, I really hesitated buying it but am glad I did. With a nice chair, ( I purchased the WorkPro Commercial Mesh Back Executive Chair) this is just a pleasure to work on.
customer_reviews.author: R. Burnthorn

customer_reviews.title: Lame product that must be installed and doesn't work correctly.
customer_reviews.text: This product must be installed. They call it a "no tool" install but 5 minutes installation the adhesive mount falls off and you need to use the included screws to screw the base to the bottom of the desk. False advertising. If you set your chair so the arm/mount is centered between your legs so you don't bang your knees on it then place the keyboard so it is centered there is no room for the mouse on the right side. So unless you are left handed this won't work for you. Poor engineering. A complete waste of money - I will never buy another 3m product.
customer_reviews.author: darkmatter

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is very heavy and well made; not flimsy or cheap. I use this at work where I am on the computer eight hours a day. It fits perfectly under my desk. It has tilt, adjusts up and down, and moves side to side so you get the perfect placement. This has really helped reduce my shoulder pain caused by my desk that is too high for me. I would definitely purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this due to shoulder pain. As a software developer I am finding that I really need to pay more attention to my body and ergonomics. This has helped quite a lot at home. Being able to adjust really nice. Having said that the only thing I wish this could do is swivel left and right, it only goes up down and has angle adjustments. Installation was pretty easy and it was better than buying a whole new desk. I was a bit afraid that my ikea wood wouldn't hold up to the weight but its been great for the past few weeks. Took maybe 30 minutes to install.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: It also does not drop as low under the desk as I'd like and the center support can take some getting used ...
customer_reviews.text: This took some modification to fit under my desk - we had a machine shop take off the back inch or so. It also does not drop as low under the desk as I'd like and the center support can take some getting used to -- I still hit my knees/thighs on it. I will probably have my handyman add a 2" spacer so I can have the keyboard lower in my lap.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary W. Wardlaw

customer_reviews.title: Likely better value elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy and highly adjustable. Although the adjustment mechanisms are less smooth than desired Installation is quite cumbersome - very surprised if it’s doable alone. Screws have been backing out and it’s less sturdy than I would have expected.
customer_reviews.author: Cole Prodan

customer_reviews.title: Well made, Easily Adjusted, Easily Installed
customer_reviews.text: Well Made: Keyboard and mouse tray are both sturdy. Swivel/tilt arm is sold and doesn't rock. Cord manager for mouse is well thought out and handy. Easily Adjusted: Mouse adjusts flat or angled and also slides to the side atop the keyboard for easier storage. Note that the mouse platform sits higher than the keyboard platform (which I recommend). Easily Installed: Borrowed my husband's tools and installed it solo. Since this is the sit/stand model, if you are using it seated the arm hangs lower than regular sit models and can get in the way. I would recommend a sit only model if that will be your usage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product, Poor Tooless Mount Performance.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the overall built quality of this keyboard tray, which fits basic ergonomic needs. I really didn't like the tooless mount because the back contact Velcro that sticks it to the table was too short (possibly a unintentional poor saving decision from 3M). It used to release and the tray would go to the floor. Also, the attachment contact levelers provide poor fit. My final decision after too many times trying to keep it in place was to screw the tray to the table. Final thing is that I let my mouse falls sideways very frequently due to not having something to constrain it. If you hit it while you are turning, it slips directly to the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Cristiano de Almeida

customer_reviews.title: Really solid and sturdy; just wish it didn't hit my knees
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard and mouse platform. It's solid as a rock. It adjusts easily. It's MUCH nicer than the cheaper ones for under $100. My only complaint is with my particular desk. It has 2" wood beams beneath the desk, so the keyboard tray mounts just below the height of my knees while I'm sitting. Hard to get my legs under the desk unless I pull the tray forward and up, and then it won't slide under the desk. UPDATE 9/26/13: I've really grown to love this tray. When I sit down at my desk, I pull the tray forward and rest it on my lap. It's a LITTLE low, but actually this is the ideal position ergonomically.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Gagne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard tray
customer_reviews.text: Instructions could have been clearer. The tray positions and adjusts easily to every position I could want. I'm very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jared DelAsmus

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: It moves in every direction, holds the keyboard steadily, doesn't bounce when you type, and has a separately positionable tray for the mouse. Others have complained about the manual and the difficult install. I didn't have any problems. It comes with some wood screws and the plate has screw holes in it. I'm not sure what part of the installation requires a manual. If I were to make a recommendation about the installation it would be not to use the included template, but instead to simply place the tray plate where you want it and mark the three holes with a pen or screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: M. O'Malley

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, very sturdy - Installation a PROBLEM!
customer_reviews.text: Once installed it works quite well. Very adjustable, and heavy duty. WARNING: However, i did have a problem installing a portion of the plate. The machine threaded screws provided were simply not long enough. The nuts could not be attached. This was very aggravating, and i don't really understand how they could get that wrong. So, be prepared. Either you'll need to go find longer screws. Or, i actually countersunk them with a drill. Still, very aggravating. But .. once installed - very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul G.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, does the job, poor instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Was a little difficult to install but not too. I didn't know how to adjust several features since (as other reviewers noted) the instructions are very poor. By chance, I twisted enough knobs, etc. to learn how to adjust it, to slide it right and left, to position the mouse tray, etc. Once installed, I couldn't get the tray to be far enough to the left to slide under my desk, but I loosened the middle screw on the deck and it then slid nicely. Very sturdy, for a single pole mount.
customer_reviews.author: JCC

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Very High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for over 2 years and I still Love it. They only thing I would recommend is if you can screw the mount to your desk. The High Strength Velcro gets weak after a while. Overall Amazing Product.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Professional office quality
customer_reviews.text: Professional grade quality. Best keyboard drawer I have had. After buying one for my wife (a real typist) I liked it so much I bought another for myself. I did not use the clamp, however, but mounted the rail directly to the bottom of the desk with screws.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M

customer_reviews.title: LOOK NO FURTHER ♡♡♡♡
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard tray. Super awesome. So happy I bought this one and spent the extra money in this tray. I work from home so if this is your livelihood buy THIS keyboard tray. You'll be so happy you did.
customer_reviews.author: AnJoBanJoe

customer_reviews.title: Just a great product
customer_reviews.text: I have the AKT150. I'm working from home now permanently and absolutely need this keyboard tray. A true game-changer. Makes it so much easier to focus and get work done. No more hunched shoulders with my arms on the desk. Thank you 3M for making this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Pagel

customer_reviews.title: works very well. a little heavy. if your ...
customer_reviews.text: works very well. a little heavy. if your table / desk that it is going to fit on is granite. you will need some type of heavy duty velcro to hold the back down. if on wooden desk, you'll have to put a screw in the back. other wise, functions very well. does the job.
customer_reviews.author: charlie

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very well built and easy to install. It helps with my shoulder arthritis and the main reason I purchased it. Glad I did not go with the less expensive models. This does it all. Just make sure you have room for a 23 inch guide under you desk or table. I guess they make a 17 inch model as well. Before you start, review your instructions and handle all the pieces so you know what is what and it should not take you more than 30 minutes to install.
customer_reviews.author: Magnum

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sit/stand keyboard tray
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard tray. It looks very sturdy and not cheaply made. I am 5'3", and I have back and knee problems so I wanted a keyboard tray that I can adjust to sitting down or at standing position. The tray adjusts perfectly well with my height when I pull it out. With it being solidly built I think the price is well worth it. I would highly recommend this sit/stand keyboard tray made by 3M. I absolutely Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Gee BeeM

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to the ratings - defective product
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard track was missing the velcro receptor on arrival. manual user attached strips peel off easily. This is going back but a huge hassle considering how bulky the item is. 3M customer service seemed to dissociate themselves with anything sold on amazon despite this being bought from 3M on Amazon. Offered to send a gift pack with scotch tape and dish rags. learnt my lesson for ignoring the 3.7 ratings and assuming 3M is a reliable brand which will not make trivial quality control mistakes but maybe the company is going downhill and these are the tell tale signs.
customer_reviews.author: pol3

customer_reviews.title: A working stable keyboard Tray!
customer_reviews.text: Before I purchased this, I bought a different brand on Amazon. It was poorly designed and very unstable. I returned it and decided to try a better known brand. It didn't take long to install a few screws and done. The platform is very stable. It can slide right under my desk for space saving. This was exactly what I was looking for in a keyboard tray.
customer_reviews.author: Toaster943

customer_reviews.title: It's absolutely perfect now.
customer_reviews.text: The packaging was intact and shipping efficient. After assembly we noticed the tray stuck out too far from the desk. My husband who is a professional carpenter took the tray off the pedestal and adjusted it to fit much better than the manufacture's design. After his adjustments it easier to adjust and sits much closer to my desk so my chair is not so far away. He raised the tray up off the pedestal and attached it to the bottom of the tray rather than the top as designed. It's absolutely perfect now.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne P

customer_reviews.title: Office must-have
customer_reviews.text: If you're typing all day you gotta have it! Most annoying part was that industrial grade grease that I accidentally got on me and my bed when installing. Keep an eye on it and you'll be okay.
customer_reviews.author: Herman Autore

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard tray without screw or nails
customer_reviews.text: I loved it! It's very stable. I love the height and angle adjustment feature, and no screw needed especially! I used it in my office desk so I don't want to drill any holes, so this is perfect! The price is a little high and the quality is worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Susu

customer_reviews.title: revolutionized my ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: This is far better than the cheapo ball-bearing slide drawer I was using. It operates smoothly, and - most importantly - there's plenty of room for my mouse on the same level as the keyboard. It's tall enough for standing too. This is day 1, but it's built like a tank, so I expect it to last. The instructions are a bit sketchy, but it's easy to install if you're reasonably handy. Requires a 1/8 pilot drill and
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Fiddaman

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard tray quickly became a pain on keeping if off my lap. When I attempted to push it back and down it wore off pieces of the tray. It will not come up to the level of the desk and tilt as the picture seemed to show. The plastic piece to cover the front mechanism kept coming off. What a mess. I would not recommend or purchase this product. I have since purchased a different product from another company and really love it!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Davis

customer_reviews.title: Works Good and Was Better Than What I Had
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an adjustable keyboard shelf to work with a desk I had modified so that the desk was on wheels. Now with this tray I can adjust the height to exactly where I want it. It helped also to center things better with my monitor. The only negative is a small mousing surface. I would have preferred something a little bigger as I find I find myself having to pick up the mouse to center it again.
customer_reviews.author: 67dodgecharger

customer_reviews.title: Great Appliance
customer_reviews.text: I have used PCs since 1986 both professionally and at home. In those years I have had 6 different workstation set-ups with different keyboard and/or mouse platforms. This one is by-far not the most expensive, but is my favorite so far. Installation was no more difficult than any other tray that I have had, and much more versatile than most. It seems to be rugged enough for daily use and easily enough adjustable to accommodate the occasional intrusion and readjustment by my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: It's might deserve 5 stars but for now I will leave it a 4. Works great, a bit stiff but that should be expected. A few people said it did not work because they have a lip on the front of their desk, I did as well I just added a section of scrap wood to bring the mounting surface down level with the lip on my desk. I use six screws to mount the extra to the desk and it is plenty strong enough to handle the work load.
customer_reviews.author: Wilderness1derer

customer_reviews.title: Descriptions does NOT match, the tray does not slide ...
customer_reviews.text: Descriptions does NOT match, the tray does not slide completely under the desk. I am returning it for different model.
customer_reviews.author: Martina Kutkova

customer_reviews.title: Tray Doesn't Operate Smoothly
customer_reviews.text: Tray doesn't pull out or push in easily. Like the tray once in the correct position.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Needs modifications. Excellent base
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use the Legos with screwy front mount. I also didn't use rear mount. That way the rail was flat and that allowed me to use the included screws. Don't let bad reviews scare you. Just use your head. Cheap sticky pads are not going to work.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This is by far one of the best purchases I've ever made. Installation was a snap, and it pulls to and fro with very little problems. It has all but eliminated my elbow and shoulder pain, and it is incredibly sturdy, with very little bounce when I type. It's a bit pricey, yes, but solidly constructed and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Raines

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, highly adjustable keyboard tray.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the product to replace another adjustable keyboard tray that got broken by a rambunctious grandson. This would have gotten a 5 star rating except for 1 thing I miss. It was easy to install, is sturdy, pulls out, slides to side , adjusts the tilt, lifts up so I can use it and stand (love this feature). All in all, I'm pleased. The thing I miss is the swivel feature my old system had. I would highly recommend this system.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have carpal tunnel syndrome and needed an adjustable keyboard tray. I also added the mount which allows me to adjust the tray from sitting to standing. Very sturdy product that was super easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Riccardi

customer_reviews.title: However the instructions for installation that are included -- were not that easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: It did install without tools. However the instructions for installation that are included -- were not that easy to follow. Requires your own ingenuity and experience. Wish they would include a YouTube link for the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: ICU-YJM

customer_reviews.title: it is incredibly sturdy. The movements are free
customer_reviews.text: was very expensive I will admit. However, it is incredibly sturdy. The movements are free... rotates easily on every axis you can imagine. Even the "precision mouse pad" (which I was not only skeptical about but also wasn't interested in) works as advertised. Bottom-line... highly configurable, solid, expensive.
customer_reviews.author: rmchl

customer_reviews.title: 4th one I have installed - because they are GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I do the ergonomic assessments in my office (35 workers) . . . .I have installed 4 of these for my coworkers, and they work great. This tray is built pretty tough, and after two years of use the first one is still working well. the second one I installed had one issue, the angle adjustment mechanism broke, I called 3M, and they overnighted a new unit to me, so I couldn't be more pleased with they way they stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as some of the more expensive keyboard trays.
customer_reviews.text: Just as good as some of the more expensive keyboard trays. Doesn't wobble much itself, though it might wobble your table a bit!
customer_reviews.author: Maximus McNobblybits

customer_reviews.title: The Track is long.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my desk buy I didn't notified there is a beam under my desk. Also the track is pretty long so I couldn't install vertically. There is only way to install is horizontal way so I can move my keyboard side to side not forward and back. The tray can be turned by side to side. That's why, I can hide my key board and mouse under the desk. But I believe that vertically install is more comfortable. If there is an other option with short track, it will be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ji Hyung Park

customer_reviews.title: I recommend their sit and stand tray
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t slide back all the way so some of the keyboard is left showing after it is installed. I recommend their sit and stand tray. Our other desks have those and they are quite nice.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Use it in my home office, and I'm very happy with it. Installation was very simple and after about a year using it, still looks good and not problems to report. I work with a computer all day and I use it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Ratzil Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect intersection between adjustability and staying in the place you ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect intersection between adjustability and staying in the place you leave it. This makes gaming or typing for work ever so relaxing. Well worth the price for the solid build.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph L Wroten

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard. I was having physical issues sitting at work for the majority of the day working on my computer. The adjustments on this keyboard are great, allowing me the ability to stand and including a tilt to avoid bending my wrists. I would rate it five stars if it had the ability to swivel left and right as well, but already feeling the difference in standing at my computer. Would also recommend raising your monitor if feasible as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: I can't envision what desk this could possible work on. The stickers aren't remotely strong enough and the tray itself weighs so much, I really don't think any sticker would work... I'm so disappointed. I bought for a glass topped desk. Do not waste your time or money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and works with a tall desk with a lip on the front.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I had to improvise a bit with the install because my desk has a lip at the front and I couldn't mount the track and then slide the tray onto the track like the instructions say. That being said, it works great and is large enough to fit a gaming keyboard and still have room for a mouse.
customer_reviews.author: J&KRansom

customer_reviews.title: Great adjustable keyboard tray!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a facility manager and have deployed these all over our building. It’s a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Maeshiro

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my new keyboard tray. Installation went well. Because the under side of my desk isn't flat/smooth because it has a extra edge around the perimeter, my husband added a piece of wood to the bottom of my desk so the track was on a flat surface. Just took an extra 5 or 10 minutes to add that small piece of wood. Operation of the features is smoooth and I love it. Being able to make fine adjustments to the keyboard tray is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Denise from WI

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: After trying a different keyboard with no success, I was very pleased to see that this tray mounted very quickly and the adjustments/movement are exactly what I needed. The "friction" type up and down movement is excellent, holding its position during all use, but able to be moved when the tray is extended out. I like the simplicity but effectiveness of this design.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Robidoux

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. Since I sit in front of a computer for 10 hours a day, it is necessary for me to have the right chair, keyboard and mouse position. This tray lets me move it around very easily to adjust for different sitting positions. I can even more up for a standing position. Great quality! Great value!
customer_reviews.author: S. Ghaemi

customer_reviews.title: 3M Easy Adjust Keyboard Tray works well.
customer_reviews.text: 3M Easy Adjust Keyboard Tray is convenient and out of the way of my desktop. Not only can you adjust its height but it is also possible to adjust the tilt and can shift the tray from one side to the other. The mouse pad is adjustable as to the tilt and the height but is a bit too short and not quite wide enough for my liking. I gave this a four star only because of the mouse pad being too short and not quite wide enough. Otherwise, I think you'll really like the 3M Easy Adjust Keyboard Tray.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Close but needs more
customer_reviews.text: The adhesive is not really strong enough for the tool free installation to work. It is easy enough to install with some wood screws so that isn't a big deal. However it really doesn't articulate very well and it is difficult to find a truly comfortable position for it.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Moorman

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but not smooth operation
customer_reviews.text: I have used this item for over a year. It is easily adjustable and very sturdy. The tray is large and versatile enough to fit nearly any size keyboard. When the removable wrist pad is removed, the tray is a flat, non-skid surface. The one flaw is that the tray does not move smoothly in and out from under the desk. When moving the tray back under the desk, you have to push hard to start the slide.
customer_reviews.author: RocketSurgeon

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: After adjustments the mouse pad is slanted right so my mouse keeps moving that way when not in use
customer_reviews.author: Henry d

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I have been looking for. At times I need to be on my feet, but also I need to use my desktop computer. This prevents me from stooping over to access my computer. I love it and have recommended it to many co-workers!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Horrible implementation of a good idea.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible implementation of a good idea. The velcro that attaches the back of the bracket will fail within a week. One half will be stuck to your desk, the other to the bracket. No problem, right? Nope. The two halves connect back up and immediately fall apart again. Horrible, horrible, horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy install.
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy install. The interlocking HEAVY DUTY VELCRO like piece at the end just needs to be REALLY pushed to lock. Not your Mom's version of velcro. Looks decent as well.
customer_reviews.author: Grey Gunner

customer_reviews.title: Was really looking forward to this and it never occurred ...
customer_reviews.text: Was really looking forward to this and it never occurred to me to look under my desk before I purchased. If you have IKEA desks this might not work...IKEA puts a frame UNDER the desk so the track has nowhere to be mounted. Really bummed. However, I did see someone online cut in to the frame on the desk so they could put this in so I might try that.
customer_reviews.author: PHILIP

customer_reviews.title: Must permanently attach
customer_reviews.text: Tried using it without drilling holes, but that doesn't work. Don't purchase unless you are able to permanently attach. Once that is done, it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Not a great option, get the upgraded AKT150LE instead from same manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: I own one of these and one of the units that you can raise and lower without the knob. Get the unit without the knob (only requires lifting). I like to have my keyboard at the appropiate height for me and tuck it away when I'm not using it. It's very inconvenient to do with this model. I ordered another AKT150LE and will be using it instead. (See separate review for AKT150LE)
customer_reviews.author: C. SMITH

customer_reviews.title: poorly made, falls apart
customer_reviews.text: not well put together, the rubber pad was misaligned, had to peel that and reposition it. Worse there's a velcro like material in the back that keeps coming apart, so the track drops and dangles. About a half square inch of the finish of mine was scuffed off.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard tray!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard for an employee at work who wanted to stand and work. I mounted this in about 30 minutes and it is built extremely well! It is a very nice stand and works as advertised. I am sure I will be buying more for other people! I recommend this tray for sit or stand it is very comfortable and built really nice!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce S.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Typing
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Great quality and great value. The adjustments help eliminate carpal tunnel syndrome. Installation was easy. Width and depth accommodate both a keyboard and mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Book Addict

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard tray was a long-overdue accessory for my desk. It was easy to mount, and so far I have not had issues with the glue attachment. My desktop is thin, only 3/4", so I didn't want to drill into it, but with the enclosed screws, it doesn't seem like it'd be a problem to fix it more permanently. Nice product! Update after 7 months of use: Problem free.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Very fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: Very fast delivery. I received it the next day. Instructions for installation should be more detailed. More detail clear pictures or actual words would be very helpful. It's heavy duty construction. Great product but doesn't work the best if installed incorrectly and you can't correct your mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: Jacque96

customer_reviews.title: I would buy another if I needed it
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. I love the way it adjusts and locks height and angle. The instructions are OK. Mine was missing a screw to hold a bracket that prevents the drawer from coming out, but all in all, this is a well made product, and the price is better than most of the competing products I found.
customer_reviews.author: JohnW

customer_reviews.title: Adjusts above and below the desktop; the keyboard does ...
customer_reviews.text: Adjusts above and below the desktop; the keyboard does slide under the mouse and presses the keys, but I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: From the

customer_reviews.title: Nice product - some adhesive failure
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. It installed easily, though there was a crack in one of the plastic brackets where the track hooks on the desk in the front. After a few weeks, the adhesive that attaches a velcro strip to the track gave way. It just took re-adhering the strip to the track. There are some screws in the front that keep the bracket in front tight to the desk. It is important that these stay tight - when they work themselves loose, it puts pressure on the adhesive parts in the back.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Great product, worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the sit and stand version. The tray itself is sturdy and I hammer on the keyboard pretty hard. The kit included some 3M double stick tape for the keyboard to stay put, and that is really nice. I'm also using the Precise Mouse Surface pad that comes with it and the gel pad. Those two additional items are much nicer than I would have expected. I have 3 total trays installed, and this is far superior in just sturdiness.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel M Morris

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a rock solid tray
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my desk at work, and had someone else install it, so I can't speak to ease of installation, but this replaces a cheesy plastic tray that used to drive me crazy because it would be so loud when I typed. This is top grade, super stable, and I absolutely love it. 5 stars, if I were buying again, I would buy this item.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. No drilling or tools needed. This also means I can take it with me whereever I go and re-install it. It's held together with very strong velcro and an adhesive pad.
customer_reviews.author: R. G.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for those who don't feel like breaking out ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product for those who don't feel like breaking out the tools. Product installed in about 5 minutes and is sturdy with a good range of motion. I got this one for my wife but will likely order another one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Redjack Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Helping with my wrist pain.
customer_reviews.text: I like this keyboard but I don't use the adjustability. Once I had it set up, I just slide it in and out of the desk, so can't attest to the adjustability. I have accidentally slid the mouse tray off the platform a couple of times. It slides on from the side, so there isn't anything to keep it from coming off. A minor thing, but it is the main reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5.
customer_reviews.author: westieluv

product_meta.title: 3M Easy Adjust Sit/Stand Keyboard Tray with Adjustable Platform, 23 Inch Track, Antimicrobial Gel Wrist Rests (AKT180LE)
product_meta.description: Style:Sit/Stand Easy Adjust| Size:Adjustable Platform3M Adjustable Keyboard Trays help place your keyboard and mouse at proper level to increase comfort and productivity. AKT180LE has an sit/stand easy adjust arm just tilt platform, adjust and release to lock in place. Adjusts height to 10" above mounting surface and 4" below mounting surface allowing you to alternate between sitting and standing positions. Tilt is adjusted by dialing tilt knob to desired angle. Sturdy platform has proprietary lateral adjustments for getting the keyboard exactly where you want it. Articulating mousing platform adjusts in all directions, tilts forward and back, and can be mounted on the right or left side of the keyboard platform. Includes leatherette gel wrist rest with antimicrobial product protection for keyboard and mouse and Precise Mouse Pad. Lifetime warranty on arm, five years on platform, and one year on gel wrist rests. Contains 25% preconsumer recycled content. Black. 3M Adjustable Keyboard Trays should only be installed on stable desks or work surfaces capable of supporting the keyboard tray and keyboard in its in-use position
feature_bullets: Sit/stand easy adjust arm just lift platform to adjust height +10"/-4" from mounting surface and tilt +10°/-15° to get to comfortable working position
Highly adjustable and sturdy keyboard and mouse platforms help get keyboard and mouse exactly where you want them for comfort
Includes easy to clean leatherette gel wrist rests and a Precise Mouse Pad with battery saving design that positions right or left
Platform swivels left and right 360° and stows completely under the desk when not is use
Lifetime warranty on keyboard arm, five years on keyboard platform, and one year on gel wrist rests
Required space under surface needed to mount: 24" W x 23.25" D
